result.execSummary:
The defendant David M Husmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
5/24/2018 AMENDED: COURT FINDS THE DEFENDANT IS ELIGIBLE FOR SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROGRAM.
Concurrent with: 3/7/2019 AMENDED TO REFLECT THIS SENTENCE IS NOT CONSECUTIVE TO BY CONCURRENT WITH ANY OTHER SENTENCE CURRENTLY BEING SERVED.
Consecutive to: any other sentence currently being served.

Same conditions as probation.
Concurrent with: 3/7/2019 AMENDED TO REFLECT THIS SENTENCE IS NOT CONSECUTIVE TO BY CONCURRENT WITH ANY OTHER SENTENCE CURRENTLY BEING SERVED.
Consecutive to: any other sentence currently being served.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: $500.00 cash bond applied. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must not possess or consume intoxicating beverages including wine or beer.   Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed health care provider and only taken in the amounts prescribed.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on or before 2/23/2017 on a Tuesday/Thursday, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM, to submit DNA sample.

Defendant David M Husmann in court with attorney James H Krave.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
No corrections/additions to the PSI by either party. 
State makes recommendation. 

Imposed & Stayed Sentence: 
4 years prison - consecutive to any other sentence currently being served - STAYED. 
2 years initial confinement. Dodge Correctional Institution. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
2 years extended supervision - consecutive to any other sentence currently being served.

3 years probation - IMPOSED. 
Must not possess or consume intoxicating beverages including wine or beer.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed health care provider and only taken in the amounts prescribed.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
100 hours community service. 
Costs
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on or before 2/23/2017, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM, to submit DNA sample.
